page.title: 03Goudhurst Village Festival,2
page.content: Societies and groups involved in the organisation of Goudhurst Festival were - The Wives' Group, the Goudhurst Sunda School, Women's Institute, Old Folks,Th Friends of St. Mary's, Royal British Legion, the Drama and Youth Clubs. Householders contributed by opening their swimming pools or gardens to the public. Sotherby's Auctioneers gave valuations on items of fine art, furniture, china, jewellery, and glass. There were several sales of produce, confectionery and novelties. The wide range of entertainments included a village quiz, folk music and wind quintet, cricket match, and Teddy Bear's party for children. The cost of amusements varied from 60p. to visit a garden to two pounds fifty for a concert followed by cheese and wine. The sum of fourteen thousand pounds was handed to the Vicar.
